Pre-Game Insights: The Cardinals currently sit third in the NL Central with a record of 69-68, while the Brewers lead the division at 80-57.
The Brewers have a 7-3 advantage over the Cardinals in their head-to-head matchups.
Milwaukee's home record stands strong at 40-25, and they are particularly effective when hitting multiple home runs, boasting a 30-8 record under such circumstances.
The Brewers have a.257 batting average with a 2.86 ERA over their last ten games, while the Cardinals have fared slightly better at.290 with a 4.40 ERA.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game is vital for both teams as they navigate through the final stretch of the regular season.
The matchup is at American Family Field in Milwaukee at 2:10 PM EDT.
The Brewers' pitching staff has been effective this season, but they have shown vulnerabilities, especially against hitters with power.
Freddy Peralta, while having a solid season, has given up significant home runs, allowing 22 in 148.1 innings pitched.
Others: The Cardinals have a solid batting lineup, ranking fifth in runs scored this season.
Their ability to generate offense will be key against the Brewers' pitching staff.
The Brewers, on the other hand, have a slightly weaker batting average at.249, ranking 12th in the league.
